Issues.Title: feat(language-service): introduce hybrid visitor to locate AST node
Issues.Body:
This commit introduces two visitors, one for Template AST and the other
for Expression AST to allow us to easily find the node that most closely
corresponds to a given cursor position.

This is crucial because many language service APIs take in a `position`
parameter, and the information returned depends on how well we can find
a good candidate node.

In View Engine implementation of language service, the search for the node
and the processing of information to return the result are strongly coupled.
This makes the code hard to understand and hard to debug because the stack
trace is often littered with layers of visitor calls.

With this new feature, we could test the "searching" part separately and
colocate all the logic (aka hacks) that's required to retrieve an accurate
span for a given node.

Right now, only the most "narrow" node is returned by the main exported
function `findNodeAtPosition`. If needed, we could expose the entire AST
path, or expose other methods to provide more context for a node.

Note that due to limitations in the template AST interface, there are
a few known cases where microsyntax spans are not recorded properly.
This will be dealt with in a follow-up PR.

Issues.Title: Show exception 'ERROR in Maximum call stack size exceeded' also without AOT mode
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 feature request

### Relevant Package
 This feature request is for @angular/x


### Description
With local development when AOT is false - you not able to see error **'ERROR in Maximum call stack size exceeded'** 
but you able to see this error at build or serve with AOT mode. In addition it doesn't show a line of code where this error happens and it will be difficult to find at what point it appeared in your changes.


### Describe the solution you'd like
Show this error also without AOT mode to make possible catch this error while development instantly.
Second solution is to report path with line of code where this error is happened.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Show exception 'ERROR in Maximum call stack size exceeded' also without AOT mode" (#38534)

Issues.Title: Demo specs missing in testing-services guide
Issues.Body:
The demo specs such as app/demo/demo.spec.ts in this guide https://angular.io/guide/testing-services are missing from the sample app https://angular.io/generated/live-examples/testing/stackblitz.html. The guide says services are often the easiest to unit test, but a new person getting started will have difficulty guessing what exactly is being imported and how someone can implement their own service tests.

The sample app is necessary because otherwise it is not obvious what ValueService even is and if getValue() is a library function or defined within ValueService.


**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Visit https://angular.io/guide/testing-services.
2. Visit first link https://angular.io/generated/live-examples/testing/stackblitz.html.
3. Try to find sample specs.

**Expected Results:**
Sample specs are in demo, showing imports.

**Actual Results:**
Sample specs are not found in demo.

![demo_specs_missing](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3093577/90661943-c7a6a800-e215-11ea-9eb8-02d1b8dd1971.JPG)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Demo specs missing in testing-services guide" (#38535)

Issues.Title: Router doesnt update URL for known routeguarded routes with HashLocationStrategy
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router@10.0.10 (may have been present previously) ### Is this a regression? Unknown ### Description Issue is only present when using the HashLocationStrategy. When accessing a route within the same lazy routing module which has a guard returning a URL tree within the same routing module, the route is updating however the URL is not. For example visit: https://angular-routeguard-redirect.netlify.app/#/register Manipulate the URL to be: https://angular-routeguard-redirect.netlify.app/#/register/two The guard will return a URL Tree redirecting you to `['/','register']` The route at https://angular-routeguard-redirect.netlify.app/#/register will be rendered The URL will still be https://angular-routeguard-redirect.netlify.app/#/register/two Refreshing causes the redirect to occur. Routes `/register`, `/register/two`, `/register/three` are all part of the same routing module (https://github.com/geometricpanda/routeguard-redirect/blob/master/src/app/pages/register/register-routing.module.ts) which is loaded here https://github.com/geometricpanda/routeguard-redirect/blob/master/src/app/app-routing.module.ts ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/geometricpanda/routeguard-redirect hosted at https://angular-routeguard-redirect.netlify.app/#/register ## 🔥 Exception or Error None Reported ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:**

run `yarn start -c serve`
```
"serve":{
  "fileReplacements": [
    {
      "replace": "src/app/app-color.ts",

  ]
}
```

If it works, the color should be green.

Issues.Title: CLI v10 Failed to decode downloaded font (OTS parsing error: incorrect entrySelector for table directory)
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 9.1.0 ### Description Angular CLI 10 doest not parse custom font correctly. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction - `ng new appTest --style=scss` - import fonts into style.scss - `ng serve` and see developer tool Minimal repo for reproduction: https://github.com/billyjov/ng-bug-font-decode ## 🔥 Exception or Error 



localhost/:1 Failed to decode downloaded font: http://localhost:4200/MaterialIcons-Regular.woff2
localhost/:1 OTS parsing error: Size of decompressed WOFF 2.0 is less than compressed size
localhost/:1 Failed to decode downloaded font: http://localhost:4200/MaterialIcons-Regular.woff
localhost/:1 OTS parsing error: incorrect file size in WOFF header
localhost/:1 Failed to decode downloaded font: http://localhost:4200/MaterialIcons-Regular.ttf
localhost/:1 OTS parsing error: incorrect entrySelector for table directory
## 🌍 Your Environment 




Angular Core: 10.0.9
Angular CLI: 10.0.6
OS: Windows 10
Browsers: Chrome latest & Firefox latest
![2020-08-19 12_04_33-MINGW64__d_bugs_ngFontBug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18737653/90621725-63cfaf80-e214-11ea-987e-2c92dc632794.png) **Anything else relevant?**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CLI v10 Failed to decode downloaded font (OTS parsing error: incorrect entrySelector for table directory) " (#18580)

Issues.Title: resolve-url-loader in styles processing
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Is this a regression? In Angular CLI 10 resolve-url-loader was added into webpack styles processing pipeline which completely break resolution of relative paths from root directory. In Angular CLI 9 everythnig works as expected. ### Description Webpack loaders in Angular CLI 9: `[style-loader, css-loader, postcss-loader, stylus-loader]` In our header component style file which is on path: `app/components/header/header.component.styl` This works in Angular CLI 9: `background-image url('./assets/images/icons/logo.png')` And assets folder is in standard Angular CLI location. Webpack loaders in Angular CLI 10: `[style-loader, css-loader, postcss-loader, resolve-url-loader, stylus-loader]` Error in Angular CLI 10: ERROR in ./src/styles.styl (./node_modules/css-loader/dist/cjs.js??ref--16-1!./node_modules/postcss-loader/src??embedded!./node_modules/resolve-url-loader??ref--16-3!./node_modules/s tylus-loader??ref--16-4!./src/styles.styl) Module Error (from ./node_modules/postcss-loader/src/index.js): (Emitted value instead of an instance of Error) CssSyntaxError: test-project\src\styles.styl:19595:26: Can't resolve './app/components/header/assets/images/icons/logo.png' in 'test-project\src' ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Generate new project wiht Angular CLI 9 and Angular CLI 10 and use realtive url from project root in style file. ## 🔥 Exception or Error 

ERROR in ./src/styles.styl (./node_modules/css-loader/dist/cjs.js??ref--16-1!./node_modules/postcss-loader/src??embedded!./node_modules/resolve-url-loader??ref--16-3!./node_modules/s
tylus-loader??ref--16-4!./src/styles.styl)
Module Error (from ./node_modules/postcss-loader/src/index.js):
(Emitted value instead of an instance of Error) CssSyntaxError: test-project\src\styles.styl:19595:26: Can't resolve './app/components/header/assets/images/icons/logo.png' in 'test-project\src'
## 🌍 Your Environment **Anything else relevant?** What is the best way, to use images in style files? It is not possible for us to change all URLs because we have hunders of images in our app. And it is not possible to use relative paths for our images because it is really frustrating. There is no mention about this breaking change in Angular CLI 10 release: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/releases/tag/v10.0.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "resolve-url-loader in styles processing" (#18579)

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>rollup/rollup</summary>

### [`v2.26.4`](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​2264)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/compare/v2.26.3...v2.26.4)

_2020-08-19_

##### Bug Fixes

-   Fix a situation where invalid code was rendered when dynamically importing a module with synthetic named exports when preserving modules ([#​3738](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3738))
-   Create a proper namespace object when in a non-es format, a namespace is imported from a chunk with `default` export mode ([#​3738](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3738))
-   Use the same variable when in a chunk, a namespace is both imported and reexported as a binding ([#​3738](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3738))
-   Do not include the synthetic namespace in static entry points unless it is actually used ([#​3738](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3738))
-   Make sure the chunking of one output does not interfere with the namespace objects of another output ([#​3738](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3738))

##### Pull Requests

-   [#​3738](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3738): Improve synthetic entry handling ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))

</details>

Issues.Title: Don't generate spec files by default?
Issues.Body:
I'm pretty sure that if it were studied, 95% of Angular generated projects don't use the spec files and either end up deleting them manually or turning spec generation off.

Perhaps do a poll or something and see.  Personally I think it would be nice if these files were not generated by default.

Issues.Title: Use SplitChunks to split environments in angular9, but it not work
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ x ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, Angular7 is work, Update to 9, it not work! and `ng serve` is work. ### Description Use [ngx-build-plus](https://github.com/manfredsteyer/ngx-build-plus) to extend the webpack config. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction use cli ``` ng build --prod --base-href ./ --plugin ~webpack.plugin.js ``` webpack.plugin.js ``` exports.default = { config(cfg) { const cacheGroups = cfg.optimization.splitChunks.cacheGroups; cfg.optimization.splitChunks.cacheGroups = { ...cacheGroups, appConfig: { // config split chunks: 'all', // change the initial, same too. name: 'appConfig', filename: 'app-config.js', test: /[\\/]src[\\/]environments[\\/]/, enforce: true, priority: 11, }, }; return cfg; } } ``` build log print ``` chunk {0} runtime-es2015.0dae8cbc97194c7caed4.js (runtime) 1.45 kB [entry] [rendered] chunk {0} runtime-es5.0dae8cbc97194c7caed4.js (runtime) 1.45 kB [entry] [rendered] chunk {3} polyfills-es2015.1c036d218568a752e64f.js (polyfills) 36.1 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {1} app-config.js (appConfig) 153 bytes [initial] [rendered] chunk {1} app-config.js (appConfig) 151 bytes [initial] [rendered] chunk {4} polyfills-es5.4044e9e97102e0a74ed1.js (polyfills-es5) 129 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {2} main-es2015.160b21a4fe71cb2eff38.js (main) 264 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {2} main-es5.160b21a4fe71cb2eff38.js (main) 315 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {5} styles.09e2c710755c8867a460.css (styles) 0 bytes [initial] [rendered] ``` ## 🔥 Exception or Error But, index.html is not inject `app.config.js` **index.html** ``` MyProject ``` ## 🌍 Your Environment

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/overlay): ensure error isn't thrown when many overlay items are closed from handler
Issues.Body:
When an event handler listening to the `outsidePointerEvents` observable closes out any open
overlays this removes them from the OverlayOutsideClickDispatcher's array of overlay elements. This
results in an error being thrown since the overlays array in the for-loop is modified (elements are
removed) and the counter not accounting for this. This fix ensures that if the array of overlay
refs is modified we don't get an off by 1 error when fetching an element from the array on
subsequent iterations of the loop.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/overlay): ensure error isn't thrown when many overlay items are closed from handler" (#20377)

Issues.Title: feat(paginator): Ability to change page size appearance
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Ability yo customize the appearance (MatFormFieldAppearance) of paginator page size options.

`<mat-paginator appearance="standard">`


#### Use Case

If you set a default appearance with `MatFormFieldDefaultOptions`, this will reflect to paginator, and there's no way to set it manualy back to default.


#### Observations

It will be really nice if we could have it in MatPaginatorDefaultOptions also. 
So we could do this to override the appearance for paginator.

```
providers: [
   {
      provide: MAT_FORM_FIELD_DEFAULT_OPTIONS,
      useValue: { appearance: 'outline' },
   },
   {
      provide: MAT_PAGINATOR_DEFAULT_OPTIONS,
      useValue: { appearance: 'standard' },
   },
],
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(paginator): Ability to change page size appearance " (#20349)

Issues.Title: tests: remove unsupported TS integration tests
Issues.Body:
**build: point to typescript node_modules folder instead of `.bin`**

Since we are installing multiple TS versions https://github.com/angular/components/blob/1f6b90c0a515397526d7c6b35f047827bfaa8652/package.json#L170-L173 yarn will link the last tsc binary which may not be the TSC version we want to use to build/test this reproduction.

Currently with the following package.json packages
```
"typescript": "3.9.5",
"typescript-3.6": "npm:typescript@~3.6.4",
"typescript-3.7": "npm:typescript@~3.7.0",
"typescript-3.8": "npm:typescript@~3.8.0",
```

If we run `npx tsc --v` the output will be `Version 3.8.3` as opposed to `3.9.5`


**build: update tests to use UMD module format**

The current version of system.js used doesn't seem to handle the `exports` correctly for TypeScript 3.9 output and causes `Cannot find variable: exports` during runtime.

With this change we change the tests module to use UMD.


**build: update to TypeScript 3.9.7**


**test: remove unsupported TS integration tests**

With this change we remove TS integration tests for unsupported TS versions.
Angular version 10 doesn't TS versions older than TS 3.9.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "tests: remove unsupported TS integration tests" (#20359)

Issues.Body: Adds a test harness for the MDC-based snack bar. One gotcha here compared to the standard snack bar is that the harness excludes (via a CSS selector) instances that are in the process of being closed. We have to take this approach, because MDC's animations are run outside of Angular and we don't have a way of waiting for them to finish.

Issues.Title: bug(Mat Tabs): focusChange event does not fire when selecting first tab
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-yrahxe?file=src%2Fapp%2Ftab-group-basic-example.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a MatTabGroup with more than one tab
2. Set selectedIndex input on MatTabGroup to any valid index above 0 
3. bind to focusChange event and attempt to work with this event
4. Select first tab
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

focusChange event should fire when a tab is changed regardless of initially selected tab (index) as a focus change occurred.


#### Actual Behavior

focusChange event does not fire if first tab is selected as internally it seems to assume the focus is on the first tab. For example, start on selectedIndex = 1 and clicking second tab will fire the event.

#### Potential Cause & Fix
It seems that in paginated-tab-header.ts, on initialization [the initially active item is always 0](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/ba521d23a4443f2c59822f22ec93ceb2ed1090a9/src/material/tabs/paginated-tab-header.ts#L198). Since we should have access to the selectedIndex by this point, setting the following may address this problem.

``
this._keyManager.updateActiveItem(this._selectedIndex);
``


#### Environment

- Angular: 10.0.0
- CDK/Material: 10.0.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Mat Tabs): focusChange event does not fire when selecting first tab" (#20374)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/overlay): ensure OverlayOutsideClickDispatcher listens to contextmenu events
Issues.Body:
If an overlay is open and a user opens a contextmenu (on an element outside the overlay) the
overlay does not close. This fix ensure that contextmenu events are treated the same way as click
events which result in the outsidePointerEvents observable emitting an event.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/overlay): ensure OverlayOutsideClickDispatcher listens to contextmenu events" (#20373)

Issues.Title: build: do not consider e2e test targets as flaky locally
Issues.Body:
Running e2e test targets locally means that Bazel will re-run
them a second time if they fail. This slows-down local development
as there is no way to see the test failure before Bazel completed
the second run. We should not consider e2e tests as flaky locally.

Developers could re-run the test themselves if they see it being
flaky. Also flaky e2e tests only seem to happen if lots of e2e
tests execute concurrently. This is not often the case locally.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: do not consider e2e test targets as flaky locally" (#20371)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-progress-bar): Progress jumps from 100 to 0, even if 0 was set and ngIf hides/shows the component
Issues.Body:
I'm resurrecting issue [#3502](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/3502).

We use a table component which on pagination, uses mat-progress-bar. when an API call is in progress, an ngIf shows mat-progress-bar, and progress increments to 100. When done, progress is set to 0, and ngIf hides the component.

When the first call is made, everything is fine. But on subsequent api calls, the progress bar after appearing suddenly slides down from 100 to 0 when it appears, even through progress was set to 0 before it showed. This is very jarring. It breaks UI conventions in a pretty fundamental way and I think needs at least a suggested workaround by the team so I can mitigate it somehow
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-progress-bar): Progress jumps from 100 to 0, even if 0 was set and ngIf hides/shows the component" (#20369)

Issues.Title: refactor: changes to support TS 4.0 compilation
Issues.Body:
With this change we refactor the code to support compilation using TS 4.0.

The main changes are:
1) Refactor tests to not delete non optional properties
2) Refactor components not to override properties with accessors and vice-versa which is now not permitted. https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-4-0-beta/#breaking-changes
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: changes to support TS 4.0 compilation" (#20368)

Issues.Title: feat(material/paginator): allow text labels for page size options
Issues.Body:
Optionally specify a text label for any `pageSizeOptions` value of the
Angular Material `paginator` component.  For example, one could include a
table's length in the list of `pageSizeOptions` and, instead of the
length, show the text "All" to the user.

Addresses #8150

Issues.Title: bug: "class" host binding conflicts with user "class bindings
Issues.Body:
#### Root cause

The following host bindings are clobbered if the user applies a dynamic class binding of their own:

```ts
host: {'class': 'mat-card-title'}
```

This does not occur in Ivy since their new algorithm handles this case and applies both bindings.

#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-utbiyp-zedm4d?file=src%2Fapp%2Fcard-fancy-example.html
 
#### Expected Behavior

Both cards should have the same styles applied.

#### Actual Behavior

Styles differ because the second card did not apply the class `mat-card-title`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug: "class" host binding conflicts with user "class bindings" (#20353)

Issues.Title: fix(datepicker): don't revalidate if new date object for same date is passed through input
Issues.Body:
If a function is used to provide a new date object for the `min` or `max` of a datepicker input, we currently trigger a revalidation on each change detection, because the input value is technically different. Historically this is something that we haven't fixed on our end, because it masks an anti-pattern on the user's end, however in this case it breaks in a non-obvious way and detecting it would be more code than just handling it.

These changes add checks in several places so that we don't trigger validators or extra change detections if a new date object for the same date is provided.

These changes also clean up the date range input which had both a `stateChanges` and `_stateChanges` streams which are required by two separate interfaces. Now there's a single `stateChanges`.

Fixes #19907.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(datepicker): don't revalidate if new date object for same date is passed through input" (#20362)

Issues.Title: feat(material/menu) Added option to close menu when outside click occurs
Issues.Body:
This is addressing: https://github.com/angular/components/issues/9320 as well as other scenarios.
The reason we use backdrop for menus in our project is to make sure user will never see multiple menus at the same time, since they don't automatically close when another one is opened.

However when using backdrop you need at least two interactions to open another menu or press another button on the page.
I've added an option to Material Menu to close the menu on outside clicks with the new outsidePointerEvents obsever added earlier this summer in this pr: https://github.com/angular/components/pull/16611.

I'm not sure it this is a valid approach, but at least it's a start and I'm open to suggestions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(material/menu) Added option to close menu when outside click occurs" (#20350)

Issues.Title: feat(cdk/testing): support waiting for tasks outside angular in protractor harness environment
Issues.Body:
We added support to harnesses for waiting until all tasks outside Angular
complete. We only added this to the `TestBed` harness environment because
it was unclear how we can get this functionality work in e2e tests.

Investigation showed that we can get it to work in a similar matter
by leveraging ZoneJS. Ideally we would only inject necessary code to
intercept ZoneJS dynamically through `browser.executeScript`, but that
does not work because we'd need to intercept the root zone for e2e
tests, unlike the proxy zone in TestBed jasmine tests. The root zone
does not keep track of the current task state, so if we intercept
at any time, we do not know if there are previously scheduled tasks
that will throw off our interceptor.

Due to this, we need to ask harness consumers in e2e tests/Protractor
tests to load a separate file before loading ZoneJS. This file will
intercept ZoneJS immediately so that the e2e/protractor harness
environment can then hook into the intercepted root zone.

More details can be found in the dedicated readme attached to this
commit. See `src/cdk/testing/zone-task-interceptor/README.md`.

Resolves COMP-333. Closes #18375.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(cdk/testing): support waiting for tasks outside angular in protractor harness environment" (#20351)
